3.6. Extensions of Sobolev functions outside of an angle
Let Aα denote the angle {z ∈ C : 0 < arg z < α}, 0 < α < 2π, and let Eα be the extension operator L1,2(Aα) → L1,2(R2) which has the least norm. Using the Radon transform, one can show that
∥Eα∥ = max { ( α / (2π − α) )1/2 , ( (2π − α) / α )1/2 }.
Problem. Find the least norm of the extension operator W 1,2(Aα) → W 1,2(R2), where
∥u∥W 1,2(Ω) = ( ∥∇u∥2L2(Ω) + ∥u∥2L2(Ω) )1/2.
